intro: Dombeya quinqueseta var. senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese dombeya, is a deciduous shrub native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a garden plant in suitable climates.
